citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS), Alaska Fisheries Science Center (AFSC)
citeinfo.title: Single-species Stock Assessment Model for the Gulf of Alaska Pollock

descript.abstract:
Single-species stock assessment model that include predation for the Gulf of Alaska pollock. Model spatial coverage is across eastern Bering Sea and Gulf of Alaska pollock distributions. Model inputs are fisheries data and predator biomass. Model outputs pollock population and mortality trends - number at age and biomass at age.
[ Reference: Hollowed, A., J. N. Ianelli, and P. Livingston. 2000. Including predation mortality in stock assessments: A case study for Gulf of Alaska pollock. ICES J. Mar. Sci 57(2):279-293. ]
[ Reference: PICES Scientific Report No. 18 2001, Proceedings of the PICES/CoML/IPRC Workshop on "Impact of Climate Variability on Observation and Prediction of Ecosystem and Biodiversity Changes in the North Pacific", http://www.pices.int/publications/scientific_reports/Report18/default.aspx. ]
descript.purpose: To understand more clearly the sources and time trends of natural mortality for pollock, by explicitly incorporating predation mortality induced by their major predators into an age-structured fish stock assessment model.
